00006 #pragma mark * #defines

00008 // Since simple integers take up the same number of bytes as a pointer,
00009 // and since it can be painful to maintain synchronization between the
00010 // extern declarations in the .h file and the assignments in the .m
00011 // file, I use #define for integer constants.  Actually, it's more efficient
00012 // since I don't need the definition for each value -- A constant used
00013 // in N places takes up only N integer-sized chunks instead of N+1.
00014 
00015 // No errors
00016 #define constBkmxErrorNone 0
00017

00075 enum BkmxFixDispo_enum
00076 {
00077         // Warning: These values = tags in Bookshelf xib > Reports > Verify
00078         // They are also used in users' user defaults, and the 0 is 
00079         // the default value in the data model.  --> Don't mess with these!
00080         BkmxFixDispoNotApplicable = -1,
00081         BkmxFixDispoToBeDetermined = 0,
00082         BkmxFixDispoLeaveAsIs = 3,
00083         BkmxFixDispoDoUpdate = 6,
00084         BkmxFixDispoLeaveBroken = 9
00085 } ;
00086 typedef enum BkmxFixDispo_enum BkmxFixDispo ;
